required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on May 29, 2018
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Open-Label Extension Study Of Tofacitinib In Psoriatic Arthritis
clinical_study.official_title: A Long-term, Open-label Extension Study Of Tofacitinib (Cp-690,550) For The Treatment Of Psoriatic Arthritis

brief_summary.textblock:
This is a Phase 3, long-term open-label extension study to evaluate the safety, tolerability and efficacy of tofacitinib in subjects with active PsA who have previously participated in randomized studies of tofacitinib for this indication.
This study will include a sub-study to evaluate the efficacy, safety and tolerability of tofacitinib 5 mg BID administered as monotherapy after methotrexate withdrawal compared to tofacitinib 5 mg BID continued in combination with methotrexate. The sub-study will be available to subjects who have completed at least 24 months of participation in the open-label extension study and meet eligibility criteria for the sub-study.

study_design_info.masking_description: The sub-study will be participant, care provider, investigator and outcomes assessor masked.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
primary_outcome.description: Counts of participants who had treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. Relatedness to [study drug] was assessed by the investigator (Yes/No). Participants with multiple occurrences of an AE within a category were counted once within the category.

primary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With Laboratory Test Values of Potential Clinical Importance
primary_outcome.description: Pre-defined criteria were established for each laboratory test to define the values that would be identified as of potential clinical importance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants With an American College of Rheumatology 20% (ACR20) Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21. Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: ACR20 response: greater than or equal to (≥) 20 percent (%) improvement in tender joint count; ≥ 20% improvement in swollen joint count; and ≥ 20% improvement in at least 3 of 5 remaining ACR core measures: participant assessment of pain; participant global assessment of disease activity; physician global assessment of disease activity; self-assessed disability (disability index of the Health Assessment Questionnaire [HAQ]); and C-Reactive Protein (CRP).

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology 50% (ACR50) Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: ACR50 response: greater than or equal to (≥) 50 percent (%) improvement in tender or swollen joint counts and 50% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: 1) physician's global assessment of disease activity, 2) subject's assessment of disease activity, 3) subject's assessment of pain, 4) subject's assessment of functional disability via a health assessment questionnaire, and 5) C-reactive protein at each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of Participants Achieving American College of Rheumatology 70% (ACR70) Response
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21. Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: ACR70 response: greater than or equal to (≥) 70 percent (%) improvement in tender or swollen joint counts and 70% improvement in 3 of the following 5 criteria: 1) physician's global assessment of disease activity, 2) subject's assessment of disease activity, 3) subject's assessment of pain, 4) subject's assessment of functional disability via a health assessment questionnaire, and 5) C-reactive protein at each visit.

secondary_outcome.measure: Score on Health Assessment Questionnaire- Disability Index
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33. Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Score on Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index patient reported outcome

secondary_outcome.measure: Number of participants achieving Psoriatic Arthritis Response Criteria (PsARC)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6. Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: PsARC is comprised of 4 clinical improvement criteria: 1 unit improvement on Physician Global Assessment: 20% (0-100 scale) improvement on the participant assessments; and 30% reduction in number of tender joints; and 30% reduction in the number of swollen joints. To achieve a clinical response, the participant must improve in 2 of the 4 PsARC criteria, 1 of which has to be the number of tender or swollen joints and none of the 4 scores could worsen

secondary_outcome.measure: Physician's Global Assessment of Psoriasis score
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21. Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: PGA Psoriasis scale ranges from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (severe disease).

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Proportion of subjects achieving at least a 75% reduction in PASI relative to baseline and PASI component scores

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Dactylitis score is based upon digit tenderness for each digit of hands and feet ranges from 0-60.

secondary_outcome.measure: Enthesitis score based upon SPARCC (Spondylitis Research Consortium) and Leeds indices
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: Enthesitis score is based upon presence/absence of enthesitis at 16 sites (SPARCC) or 6 sites (Leeds)

secondary_outcome.measure: Bath Ankylosing Spondylitis Disease Activity Index (BASDAI)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Month 15, Month 18, Month 21, Month 24, Month 27, Month 30, Month 33, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: BASDAI is a validated self-assessment tool used to determine disease activity in participant with Ankylosing Spondylitis (AS) utilizing a visual analogue scale of 0-10 (0=none and 10=very severe). Answers to six questions measuring are averaged for a final score ranging from 0-10.

secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 6, Month 12, Month 18, Month 24, Month 30, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well-being. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

secondary_outcome.measure: Euro Quality of Life (EQ-5D)- Health State Profile Utility Score (EQ-5D)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 6, Month 12, Month 18, Month 24, Month 30, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: EQ5D is a participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. Health State Profile component assesses level of current health for 5 domains; 1 indicates better health state (no problems) and 3 indicates worst health state.

secondary_outcome.measure: Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy- Fatigue (FACIT-F)
secondary_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 6, Month 12, Month 18, Month 24, Month 30, Month 36
secondary_outcome.description: FACIT-F is a participant rated questionnaire to assess fatigue

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Primary Measure of Sub-study: Change from Baseline in Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index (HAQ-DI)
other_outcome.description: Change in score from the baseline visit in the sub-study of the Health Assessment Questionnaire-Disability Index

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Primary Measure of Sub-study: Change from Baseline in the Psoriatic Arthritis Disease Activity Score
other_outcome.description: Change in PASDAS from the baseline visit in the sub-study

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: HAQ-DI
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline HAQ-DI score in the sub-study

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: PASDAS
other_outcome.description: Change from Baseline in PASDAS in the sub-study

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Physician's Global Assessment of Psoriasis (PGA-PsO) score
other_outcome.time_frame: Month 1, Month 3, Month 6, Month 9, Month 12, Follow-up
other_outcome.description: PGA -PsO ranges from 0 (no psoriasis) to 5 (severe disease).

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of the Sub-study: Number of subject achieving Psoriatic Arthritis Response Criteria (PsARC)
other_outcome.description: PsARC is comprised of 4 clinical improvement criteria: 1 unit improvement on Physician Global Assessment: 20% (0-100 scale) improvement on the participant assessments; and 30% reduction in number of tender joints; and 30% reduction in the number of swollen joints. To achieve a clinical response, the participant must improve in 2 of the 4 PsARC criteria, 1 of which has to be the number of tender or swollen joints and none of the 4 scores could worsen

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Body Surface Area (BSA)
other_outcome.description: Percent change from baseline of the BAS in the sub-study.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Dactylitis Severity Score
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the sub-study of the Dactylitis Severity Score. Dactyltis score based upon digit tenderness for each digit of hands and feet ranges from 0-60

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Number of subjects with an absence of dactylitis
other_outcome.description: Utilizing the Dactylitis Severity Score results, the number of subjects in the sub-study without dactylitis noted.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Leeds Enthesitis Index Score
other_outcome.description: Change from baseline in the sub-study of the Leeds Enthesitis Index. Leeds Enthesitis score based upon presence/absence of enthesitis of 6 sites.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Absence of Enthesitis using the Leeds Enthesitis Index
other_outcome.description: Utilizing the Leeds Enthesitis Index results, the number of subjects in the sub-study without enthesitis.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Number of subjects achieving a Minimal Disease Activity (MDS) Response
other_outcome.description: A psoriatic arthritis subject is defined as meeting MDA when 5 or greater of the 7 criteria are met: 1) tender/painful joint count < or equal to 1; 2) swollen joint count < or equal to 1; 3) BSA < or equal to 3%; 4) Patient Assessment of Arthritis Pain (by visual analog scale[VAS]) < or equal to 15 mm; 5) Patient Global Assessment of Arthritis VAS < or equal to 20 mm; 6) HAQ-DI < or equal to 0.5; 7) Leeds Enthesitis Index < or equal to 1.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Change in ACR components
other_outcome.description: HAQ-DI, CRP, Patient's Assessment of Arthritis Pain, Patient's Global Assessment of Arthritis, Physician's Global Assessment of Arthritis, swollen joint count, tender/painful joint count

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure of Sub-study: Change in 36-Item Short-Form Health Survey (SF-36)
other_outcome.description: SF-36 is a standardized survey evaluating 8 aspects of functional health and well-being. The score for a section is an average of the individual question scores, which are scaled 0-100 (100=highest level of functioning).

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure in Sub-study: Change in Functional Assessment of Chronic Illness Therapy- Fatigue (FACIT-F)
other_outcome.description: FACIT-F is a participant rated questionnaire to assess fatigue

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure in Sub-study: Change in Euro Quality of Life - Health State Profile Utility Score (EQ-5D)
other_outcome.description: EQ5D is a participant rated questionnaire to assess health-related quality of life in terms of a single utility score. Health State Profile component assesses level of current health for 5 domains; 1 indicates better health state (no problems) and 3 indicates worst health state.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure in Sub-study: Number of Participants With Adverse Events (AEs) and Serious Adverse Events (SAEs)
other_outcome.description: Counts of participants who had treatment-emergent adverse events (TEAEs), defined as newly occurring or worsening after first dose. Relatedness to [study drug] was assessed by the investigator (Yes/No). Participants with multiple occurrences of an AE within a category were counted once within the category.

other_outcome.measure: Exploratory Secondary Measure in Sub-study: Number of Participants With Laboratory Test Values of Potential Clinical Importance
other_outcome.description: Pre-defined criteria were established for each laboratory test to define the values that would be identified as of potential clinical importance.

intervention.description: Placebo to match active methotrexate orally once a week

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Previous participation in qualifying PsA study involving tofacitinib
Exclusion Criteria:
- Time from End of Study visit of qualifying study is >3 months.
- Pregnant female, breastfeeding female or female of childbearing potential unwilling or unable to use highly effective birth control for duration of study and one ovulatory cycle thereafter.
Sub-study Inclusion Criteria:
- Subjects who have completed at least 24 months of treatment with tofacitinib in the extension study
- Subjects on a stable oral dose of methotrexate (maximum dose 20 mg per week)
Sub-study Exclusion Criteria:
-Subjects who are receiving methotrexate by a route other than oral
